name: rumex
edibility: Leaves for flavoring, flowers, and seeds.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: Fruit is a reddish brown, 3-angled achene, often with a round tubercle on one or all three sides.
flower-description: Flowers small, in terminal, branched clusters, red or green. Flowers are carried above the leaves in clusters.
leaf-description: Leaves form a basal rosette at the root , which differs from the leaves near the flowers. They may or may not have stipules. Minor leaf veins occur.
stem-description: Erect, ascending, or prostrate, glabrous or papillose-pubescent.
poison-symptoms:
Ingesting leaves in large quantities and if not cooked properly can cause nausea, stomach cramps, vomiting, headache.
Kidney failure (rare in dogs/cats), tremors, salivation.
